column2: This character died of natural causes
I have a cunning plan! I shall sell cider to the other children and make a fortune thusway!
It seems your ward has a cunning plan to sell cider to the other children and make a fortune! Such plans will surely help him as an adult.
Encourage [From.GetHerHim] to go on with [From.GetHerHis] plans.
Stop [From.GetHerHim] from taking advantage of those poor children!
Sounds like an opportunity to make some profit for myself as well!

You seem to be very interested in the garments the courtiers are wearing. Yet... not in the usual lustful way. It seems you are also interested in the fabrics themselves, not just what’s underneath them!
This is interesting, I wonder what my guardian will think about this...
A decision needs to be made!

Your ward seems to be very interested in the garments the courtiers are wearing. Yet... not in the usual lustful way. It seems [From.GetSheHe] is also interested in the fabrics themselves, not just what’s underneath them!
Make [From.GetHerHim] concentrate on the more important things in life!
Such a good sense of fashion! I should force everyone to adopt [From.GetHerHis] new trends!
While on a casual stroll in the woods you spot something suspicious and alert your guardian!
While on a casual stroll in the woods, your ward spots something suspicious!
Must be some game out there!
Tell the annoying brat not to bother me!
Yes, I see it... it’s a deer! This child is a natural tracker, I should learn from [From.GetHerHim]!
Yes, I see it... it’s a deer! I must leave the child behind and hunt it on my own!
You stumbled upon the kitchen... and decided to try and cook something all by yourself.
Wonder what my guardian will think about this...
You stumbled upon the kitchen, where you see your ward [From.GetBestName] all alone... cooking something!
It actually smells good... I will have a taste!
Smells good tastes bad! This is awful!
Smells good tastes better! Encourage the child to cook some more.
Not bad... will be better if we add to it the boar I hunted yesterday!
You've been spending most of your free time at the kennels.
Wonder what my guardian will think about this...
You notice your ward spends most of his free time at the kennels.
Ban [From.GetHerHim] from going there and force [From.GetHerHim] to play with the other children!
Encourage [From.GetHerHim] to train the dogs for hunting!
Encourage [From.GetHerHim] to breed a new race of dogs and name it after yourself!
You are fascinated by stories of local travelers, they tell of distant new lands and people and exotic foods...
Wonder what my guardian will think about this...
You notice your ward is fascinated by stories of local travelers, they tell of distant new lands and people and exotic foods...
[From.GetSheHeCap] seems restless, ask the huntmaster to take [From.GetHerHim] somewhere interesting. Yet safe.
Encourage [From.GetHerHim] to stop daydreaming and concentrate on court duties.
Offer to take [From.GetHerHim] on a tour of your demesne!
The most amusing thing in the world for you, is to pass wind in public and blame the man next to you.
Wonder what my guardian will think about this...
You notice your ward passes wind in public and bursts into laughter while pointing at the nearest man to [From.GetHerHim]...
Who cares, i have more important things to do...
Beat it out of [From.GetHerHim]! This is not proper behavior!
Your playmates burst into your bedroom in the middle of the night, screaming that dragons are attacking!
I must wake up my guardian, who will know what to do!
Your ward wakes you up in the middle of the night to warn you about dragons attacking! Turns out [From.GetSheHe] was pranked by [From.GetHerHis] playmates...
Appoint [From.GetHerHim] "head dragon hunter" as a joke.
Wake up and explain to [From.GetHerHim] about practical jokes.
Dragons?! Beat [From.GetHerHim] to a pulp for waking you up!
You decide to wake up your playmate in the middle of the night to warn him of an immenent dragon attack!
Wonder what my guardian will think about this...
Your ward woke up [From.GetHerHis] playmate in the middle of the night to warn him of an imminent dragon attack! They spent all night outside "hiding".
Appoint [From.GetHerHim] "head dragon hunter" as a joke.
You find making friends very easy.
Wonder what my guardian will think about this...
Your ward finds making friends very easy.
You spend a lot of time in front of the mirror.
Wonder what my guardian will think about this...
Your ward spends too much time in front of the mirror.
Give [From.GetHerHim] tips about how to look better.
Your ward is boring everyone [From.GetSheHe] speaks with...
Wonder what my guardian will think about this...
Your ward seems to hate everyone...
You notice everyone around you makes stupid mistakes, and that it is your duty to point them out to them.
Wonder what my guardian will think about this...
You notice your ward goes around correcting people.
You find a coin. You decide to keep it. Keep it safe, for a rainy day.
Wonder what my guardian will think about this...
You notice your ward never spends any money.
Piety is respected by the clergy and especially the head of your Church. It can be spent to petition the head of your Church. Like Authority, it is added to your score on the death of a ruler.

Changed Succession Law in my favor

Forced me to become a vassal
The populist rebels have overthrown you in favor of a republic!
Peasants in [From.GetName] have risen up in support of the ongoing Populist revolt!
Peasants in [Root.GetName] have risen up in support of the ongoing Populist revolt!
Peasants in [From.GetName] have risen up, led by a rabble rouser. They have the gall to demand a republican form of government!
Peasants in [Root.GetName] have risen up, led by a rabble rouser. They have the gall to demand a republican form of government!
Peasants in [From.GetName] have risen up in support of the ongoing Martial revolt!
Peasants in [Root.GetName] have risen up in support of the ongoing Martial revolt!
Peasants in [From.GetName] have risen up, led by a retired soldier. They have the gall to demand they be ruled by a true warrior!
Peasants in [Root.GetName] have risen up, led by a retired soldier. They have the gall to demand they be ruled by a true warrior!
The Messianic rebels have overthrown you in favor of a theocracy!
Peasants in [From.GetName] have risen up in support of the ongoing Messianic revolt!
Peasants in [Root.GetName] have risen up in support of the ongoing Messianic revolt!
Peasants in [From.GetName] have risen up, led by a charismatic cleric. They have the gall to demand they be ruled by a man of faith!
Peasants in [Root.GetName] have risen up, led by a charismatic cleric. They have the gall to demand they be ruled by a man of faith!

A great council of theologians and philosophers has assembled in [Root.Location.GetName] to discuss matters of the faith under your guidance. The gathering will strenghten the authority of the [Root.Religion.GetName] religion and reduce the influence of heresies and other faiths.
your liege is informed about the council.

A great council of theologists and philosophers has assembled in [Root.job_spiritual.Location.GetName] to discuss matters of the faith under the guidance of [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledName]. The gathering has significantly increased the authority of the [Root.Religion.GetName] religion and reduced the influence of other faiths.
The doctrinal council at [Root.job_spiritual.Location.GetName] has approves of your ruler as a true devout and follower of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.
The doctrinal council at [Root.job_spiritual.Location.GetName] has approves of you as a true devout and follower of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.
The doctrinal council at [Root.job_spiritual.Location.GetName] has accused your ruler of being corrupt and not following the teachings of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.
The doctrinal council at [Root.job_spiritual.Location.GetName] has accused you of being corrupt and not following the teachings of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.
As a result of a successful Council of Faith, the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith has increased its influence.
Good news, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA]. The Council of Faith was a great success, and the influence of [Root.Religion.GetName] has increased!
My haranguing of the faithful has encouraged multitudes of them to join our cause.
Good new, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA]. A zealot has gathered multitudes of the faithful to join our cause!
Thanks to my haranguing of the masses, the people are working harder.
Good news, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA]. The people are working harder!
Bad news, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA]. The rally has gotten out of control!
Other voices have arisen and drowned me out. I have lost control of the rally!
My haranguing of the masses has encouraged multitudes of the masses to join our cause.
Good news, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA]. Multitudes of the masses have decided to join our cause!
Thanks to my leadership at the Academic Conference, our research has advanced by leaps and bounds.
Good news, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA]. The Academic Conference is producing get strides in research!
I have discovered a most learned scholar and inventor at the conference, and persuaded him to accept [Root.Liege.GetBestName]'s patronage.
Good news, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA]. I have persuaded a most learned attendee at the conference to join your court!
We have no need for his talents.
Grievous news, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA]. The conference has dissolved in disarray, and we have nothing to show for it.
Everything went exactly as planned, with all ceremonies carried out precisely as prescribed.
Good news, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA]. The ceremony was a great success!
What a disaster! The rituals were ruined by peasants protesting our sacrificing their best kine!
Grievous news, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA]. The rituals were disrupted by peasants protesting our sacrificing their best kine!
That sounds like an excellent idea.
Too much trouble, I'll just stay here.
The woods? At night? But they're dark and scary...
Maybe a walk in the woods will cheer me up...
Naw, I don't really feel like it.

column3: I think I'll go for a walk.

column2: But if I left, I'd have to walk...
No way, it's too dangerous! There might be lions, or tigers, or bears, oh my!
Maybe a walk in the wild will cheer me up...
Naw, I don't really feel like it.
I feel so much better now!
A single shaft of moonlight caught his skeletal hand
column3: it was white as bone!

column2: Lifeless figures! They are undead, all of them!
My spirit is lifted from me!
My spirit is lifted from me, and replaced with another!
Let me tell you a story to chill your bones...
Hey AI, you want to go get some slaves from this person?

column3: Déposer le suzerain
Déposer [This.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]

column2: Members seek to force [This.Liege.GetTitledName] to abdicate in favour of [This.Liege.GetHerHis] heir [This.Liege.Heir.GetTitledName]. When sufficiently powerful, §Y[From.GetBestName]§! may present an ultimatum to §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§!.
column3: Les membres cherche à forcer [This.Liege.GetTitledName] à abdiquer en de son héritier(e) [This.Liege.Heir.GetTitledName]. Lorsque le complot sera suffisamment puissant, §Y[From.GetBestName]§! pourra présenter un ultimatum à §Y[From.Liege.GetBestName]§!.
Exiger l'abdication de [This.Liege.GetTitledFirstName].

column2: Present an ultimatum to §Y[Root.Liege.GetBestName]§!, demanding that [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] abdicate in favour of [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] heir [Root.Liege.Heir.GetTitledFirstName]. If [Root.Liege.GetSubjectPronoun] refuses to comply, the Faction will rise in revolt.
column3: Présenter un ultimatum à §Y[Root.Liege.GetBestName]§!, exigeant qu'[Root.Liege.GetSheHe] abdique en faveur de son hériter(e) [Root.Liege.Heir.GetTitledFirstName]. Si [Root.Liege.GetSubjectPronoun] refuse de se soumettre, la faction se révoltera.

column2:
[Root.GetFirstName] [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], your reign of misrule must come to an end immediately, me and my allies insist that you abdicate in favour of your heir [Root.Heir.GetTitledFirstName]. Be reasonable and let us not resort to bloodshed.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
[Root.GetFirstName] [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName], votre règne abject doit s'achever immédiatement, moi et mes alliés insistont pour que vous adbiquiez en faveur de votre héritier(e) [Root.Heir.GetTitledFirstName]. Soyez raisonnable et évitez un bain de sang.

Signé,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2:
Great [Root.GetTitledFirstName]! I and a powerful group of loyalists have presented an ultimatum to [From.Liege.GetTitledName] demanding [From.Liege.GetSheHe] ends [From.Liege.GetHerHis] reign of misrule and abdicate in favour of yourself. Wish us luck!

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
Grand [Root.GetTitledFirstName]! Moi et un puissant groupe de loyalistes avons présenté un ultimatum à [From.Liege.GetTitledName] exigeant qu'[From.Liege.GetSheHe] mette fin à son règne abject et abdique en votre faveur. Souhaitez nous bonne chance !

Signé,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2:
Your lack of faith in my duties as your liege saddens me, but I do recognize the fact [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] may be better off if I step aside. With regret, I hereby abdicate in favour of my heir [From.Heir.GetTitledName]

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
Votre manque de foi en mes capacités à remplir mes devoirs me chagrine, mais je reconnais que [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] pourrait être plus efficace et digne que moi. Avec regret, j'abdique en faveur de mon héritier(e) [From.Heir.GetTitledName]

Signé,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2:
In order to avoid a fruitless civil war, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has wisely agreed to abdicate in favour of [From.Heir.GetTitledFirstName]. Your valuable support in this matter will not be forgotten.

Sincerely,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
column3:
Pour éviter une guerre civile inutile, [From.GetTitledFirstName] a sagement accepté d'abdiquer en faveur de [From.Heir.GetTitledFirstName]. Votre soutien dans cette affaire ne sera pas oublié.

Sincèrement,
[FromFrom.GetTitledName]

column2:
To all my subjects,  after listening to the advice of [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], I have come to realise I am no longer able to reign as your liege [From.GetTitle]. Therefore I hereby abdicate all my lands and titles in favour of my heir [From.Heir.GetTitledName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
column3:
A tous mes sujets, après avoir entendu les conseils de [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], j'en suis venu à réaliser que je n'étais pas plus capable de régner comme votre [From.GetTitle]. Aussi, par la présente, je renonce à toutes mes terres et titres en faveur de mon hériter(e) [From.Heir.GetTitledName].

Signé,
[From.GetTitledName]

column2: You decided the current war was a perfect opportunity to improve your knowledge of military matters, so you eagerly participated in the council of war with your bannermen and officers. Much of what they said on the finer points of strategy and battle tactics went over your head, but you feel your understanding of war has improved anyway.
column3: Vous avez décidé que la guerre actuelle était une opportunité parfaite pour améliorer vos connaissances militaires, aussi participez-vous avec joie au conseil de guerre avec vos bannerets et officiers. Les discussions les plus pointues en matière de stratégie et de tactiques militaires vous passent au dessus de la tête, mais vous sentez quand même que votre compréhension des choses de la guerre a progressé.

column2: One day they will look to me for a plan
column3: Un jour ils s'en remettront à moi pour élaborer un plan de bataille.

column2: This character has ignored the democratic laws of his realm and now faces public disapproval

column3: Mandat

column2: The length of time each leader holds power between elections.
column3: La durée pendant la quelle le dirigeant détient le pouvoir entre deux éléctions.
Mandat de quatre ans
Court
Les dirigeants détiennent le pouvoir pendant quatre ans avant qu'un autre ne puisse être élu.
Mandat de quatre ans
Court

column2: Leaders hold power for four years before a new leader must be elected.
column3: Les dirigeants détiennent le pouvoir pendant quatre ans avant qu'un autre ne puisse être élu.
Mandat de six ans
Moyen

column2: Leaders hold power for six years before a new leader must be elected.
column3: Les dirigeants détiennent le pouvoir pendant six ans avant qu'un autre ne puisse être élu.
Mandat de dix ans
Long

column2: Leaders hold power for ten years before a new leader must be elected.
column3: Les dirigeants détiennent le pouvoir pendant dix ans avant qu'un autre ne puisse être élu.
Pas de durée de mandat
A vie

column2: Leaders hold power for life or until they are removed from power.
column3: Les dirigeants gardent le pouvoir à vie ou jusqu'à ce qu'ils soient démis de leurs fonctions...

column2: Your current term as [Root.GetTitle] of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has expired. The elections are to be held immediately.
This character was deposed from rule
Your liege, [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has refused to hold elections in your realm.
Member of a faction seeking to depose their liege
Leads a faction seeking to depose their liege
This ruler has been deposed four faulting to the morals of their faith.
Your young ward [From.GetBestName] has become ruthless in his games, doing everything possible to win, no matter how dishonorable.
There is nothing more I can do.
There's a chip off the old block.
Your young ward [From.GetBestName] always follows the rules, even if this puts [From.GetHerHim] at a disadvantage.
I'm proud to be teaching such an honorable child.
is informed of the results of the duel.
I don't see why I should care for the feelings of others anymore. I am no longer Kind.
column3: Je ne vois pas pourquoi je devrais me préoccuper des sentiments d’autrui, j’ai perdu le trait "Gentil".

column2: I have come to realize that my benevolence upon others is wasted. I am no longer Charitable.
column3: Je me suis rendu compte que ma générosité et ma bienveillance envers autrui n'était que du gaspillage, je ne suis plus "Charitable".

column2: This character wants [This.GetHerHis] name to be known throughout the known world.
The realm is tolerant of other religions. This means higher religious flexibility but lower chance to convert provinces.
The realm is indifferent of other religions. This is the neutral stance and provides no benefits or inconveniences.

The realm is intolerant to other religions. This means lower religious flexibility but higher chance to convert provinces and the possibility to wage war against blasphemous rulers and religious enemies. Effective enforcement of this policy requires a sufficient degree of centralization.

The Religious Tolerance of your realm determines the policy towards foreign religions in your realm. Tolerant realms will have lower chance to convert provinces while Intolerant ones will have higher chances in addition to having more opportunities to wage religious wars.

column3: Varègue
column4: Waräger
column6: varangian_traito

column2: This character is a veteran of a mercenary company.
column3: Ce personnage est un vétéran de la Garde varègue.
column4: Dieser Charakter ist Veteran der Warägergarde.
column6: Este personaje es un veterano de la Guardia varangian_traita.

column2: Your son, [From.GetTitledFirstName], has decided to enlist with a mercenary company in foreign lands and seek his fortune there! Although he will no doubt gain both riches and valuable battle experience fighting in great battles, there will be many perils that could well cost him his life.
column3: Votre fils, [From.GetTitledFirstName], a décidé de s'enrôler dans une compagnie d'épées-louées des Cités Libres d'y chercher fortune ! Même si toutes ces campagnes et batailles vont sans doute l'enrichir d'une importante expérience de combat, de nombreux dangers pourront lui coûter la vie.
column4: Euer Sohn, [From.GetTitledFirstName], hat beschlossen, sich der Warägergarde in Miklagard anzuschließen und dort sein Glück zu suchen. Obschon er zweifellos sowohl Reichtum als auch wertvolle Kampferfahrung im Dienst des Griechenkönigs finden wird, gibt es viele Gefahren, die ihn sein Leben kosten könnten.
column6: ¡Tu hijo, [From.GetTitledFirstName], ha decidido alistarse con la Guardia varangian_trait en Miklagård y buscar fortuna allí! Aunque, sin duda, obtendrá riquezas y valiosa experiencia en batalla al servicio del rey Griego, habrá muchos peligros que bien podrían costarle la vida.

column2: Go forth and make me proud, son.
column3: Fils, va et fais-moi honneur.
column4: Gehe nach Miklagard und mache mich stolz, mein Sohn.
column6: Vete a Miklagård y hazme sentirme orgulloso, hijo.

column2: A grizzled old warrior from foreign lands has arrived bearing word from [From.GetTitledFirstName] today. Though he has left the mercenary company, your son has apparently found himself a foreign wife and decided to remain abroad to build a new life there. It is doubtful whether you will ever see him again...
column3: Un vieux guerrier grisonnant est revenu aujourd'hui des Cités Libres, portant un message pour [From.GetTitledFirstName]. Bien qu'il ait quitté la compagnie d'épées-louées, votre fils s'est apparemment trouvé une épouse étrangère et a décidé de rester là où il est pour y refaire sa vie. Vous ne le reverrez probablement plus jamais...
column4: Ein grauhaariger alter Krieger ist gerade aus Griechenland mit Nachricht von [From.GetTitledFirstName] heimgekehrt. Auch wenn er die Warägergarde verlassen hat, hat Euer Sohn wohl eine griechische Braut gefunden und beschlossen, in Miklagard zu bleiben und ein neues Leben zu beginnen. Es ist zweifelhaft, ob Ihr ihn jemals wiedersehen werdet...
column6: Un guerrero canoso recién llegado de Grecia llega hoy con un mensaje de [From.GetTitledFirstName]. Aunque ha dejado la Guardia varangian_traita, tu hijo parece haber encontrado una esposa Griega y decidido permanecer en Miklagård y crear una nueva vida allí. Es dudoso que alguna vez lo vuelvas a ver...

column2: A heavily scarred warrior clad in strange armor approaches your throne, and before he can be disarmed, the stranger relieves your guard of his spear in a swift, fluid motion and tosses it aside. Other guards hurry forward, but you raise your hand to stop them. The stranger is [From.GetTitledFirstName], at last returned from his adventure in foreign lands!
column3: Un guerrier profondément balafré, revêtu d'une étrange armure, s'approche de votre trône et, avant qu'on n'ait pu le désarmer, l'étranger, d'un mouvement prompt et adroit, désarme votre garde et jette sa lance par terre. Les autres gardes s'approchent en vitesse, mais vous levez votre bras pour les arrêter. L'étranger est [From.GetTitledFirstName], enfin revenu de ses aventures dans les Cités Libres !
column4: Ein vernarbter Krieger in seltsamer Rüstung erscheint vor Eurem Thron und bevor er entwaffnet werden kann, entreißt der Fremde Eurer Wache den Speer und wirft ihn beiseite. Andere Wachen eilen heran, doch Ihr hebt die Hand um sie aufzuhalten. Der Fremde ist [From.GetTitledFirstName] und endlich aus Griechenland heimgekehrt!
column6: Un guerrero con grandes cicatrices y vestido con una extraña armadura se acerca a tu trono, y antes de que pueda ser desarmado, el desconocido se quita de encima a la guardia con un movimiento rápido y fluido de su lanza, y la arroja a un lado. Otros guardias se apresuran hacia él, pero levantas la mano para detenerlos. ¡El desconocido es [From.GetTitledFirstName], por fin ha regresado de Grecia!

column2: Your son, [From.GetTitledFirstName], has finally returned home from foreign lands and his service with the mercenary company! Although you can't quite put your finger on it, he seems different somehow...
column3: Votre fils, [From.GetTitledFirstName], est finalement revenu des Cités Libres et de son service dans une compagnie d'épées-louées ! Bien que vous ne pouvez encore dire pourquoi, il semble quelque peu différent...
column4: Euer Sohn, [From.GetTitledFirstName], ist endlich aus Griechenland und dem Dienst in der Warägergarde zurückgekehrt. Obschon Ihr es nicht genau benennen könnt, wirkt er irgendwie verändert... Und was genau hat es mit dieser 'griechischen Liebe' auf sich, von der er spricht?
column6: ¡Tu hijo, [From.GetTitledFirstName], por fin ha vuelto a casa de Grecia y de su servicio con la Guardia varangian_traita! Aunque no sabes por qué, parece diferente de alguna manera... y ¿qué es este amor griego del que habla?

column2: A frail, robed man is led into your throne room, and your guards explain that he just arrived on a ship coming from foreign lands. The man would only speak your name over and over again, and so he was brought to you. To your horror, you recognize him at last as [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
column3: Un homme frêle et vêtu d'une robe est mené dans votre salle du trône et vos gardes expliquent qu'il vient tout juste de débarquer d'un navire en provenance des Cités Libres. L'homme répétait inlassablement le même mot : votre nom. Vous frémissez d'horreur en le reconnaissant, c'est [From.GetTitledFirstName] !
column4: Ein gebrechlicher, berobter Man wird in Euren Thronsaal geführt und Eure Wachen erklären, dass er gerade mit dem Schiff von Miklagard eingetroffen ist. Der Mann sprach nur wieder und wieder Euren Namen, daher wurde er zu Euch gebracht. Voller Erschrecken erkennt Ihr ihn schließlich als [From.GetTitledFirstName]!
column6: Un hombre frágil vestido con túnica es conducido a tu sala del trono, y tus guardias explican que acaba de llegar en un barco procedente de Miklagård. El hombre sólo dice tu nombre una y otra vez, y por eso lo han llevado a ti. Para tu horror, ¡lo reconoces por fin como [From.GetTitledFirstName]!

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has finally returned home after a long and successful career as a mercenary! He fought in several battles, and learned much from the clever strategies and tactics favoured by many foreign lands.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] est finalement de retour au bercail après une fructueuse et longue carrière comme épée-louée ! Il a pris part à plusieurs batailles et a beaucoup appris sur les adroites stratégies et les tactiques utilisées par les habitants des Cités Libres.
column4: [From.GetTitledFirstName] ist nach langer und erfolgreicher Karriere in der Warägergarde endlich heimgekehrt! Er hat in vielen Schlachten gefochten und vieles von den schlauen Strategien und Taktiken der Griechen und ihrer Feinde in Serkland erfahren.
column6: ¡[From.GetTitledFirstName] por fin ha vuelto a casa después de una larga y exitosa carrera en la Guardia varangian_traita! Luchó en varias batallas, y aprendió mucho de las inteligentes estrategias y las tácticas preferidas tanto por los griegos como por sus enemigos en Serkland.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from foreign lands after his service with the mercenary company, but he refuses to speak of his experiences there. You know he took part in several battles and killed many foes, but instead of revelling in the glory of his accomplishments, [From.GetFirstName] is plagued by nightmares and jumps at sudden sounds.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] est de retour des Cités Libres et de sa Compagnie d'épées-louées, mais refuse de parler de son expérience là-bas. Vous savez qu'il a pris part à plusieurs batailles et qu'il a eu raison de nombreux ennemis, mais au lieu de raconter ses glorieux exploits, [From.GetFirstName] fait des cauchemars toutes les nuits et sursaute au moindre bruit.
column4: [From.GetTitledFirstName] ist aus Griechenland und der Warägergarde zurückgekehrt, aber er weigert sich, von seinen Erlebnissen zu sprechen. Ihr wisst, dass er an etlichen Schlachten teilgenommen und viele Feinde erschlagen hat, doch statt seine glorreichen Erfolge zu feiern, wird [From.GetFirstName] von Alpträumen geplagt und erschreckt bei plötzlichen Geräuschen.
column6: [From.GetTitledFirstName] ha regresado de Grecia y de la Guardia varangian_traita, pero se niega a hablar de sus experiencias allí. Tú sabes que participó en varias batallas y mató a muchos enemigos, pero en vez de deleitarse en la gloria de sus logros, [From.GetFirstName] está plagado de pesadillas y salta con los ruidos repentinos.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has come home from foreign lands after his service with the mercenary company, but he is not alone. He has found an exotic wife and brought her with him. She is not familiar with our customs or language, and the climate does not seem to agree with her, but she seems willing to make the best of her new home.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] est de retour des Cités Libres et de son service dans une compagnie d'épée-louée, mais il ne revient pas seul. Il s'est marié à une femme exotique qu'il a ramené avec lui. Elle n'est pas habituée à nos coutumes et à notre langue, et ne semble pas apprécier notre climat, mais elle semble vouloir faire d'ici son chez soi.
column4: [From.GetTitledFirstName] ist aus Miklagard und seinem Dienst in der Warägergarde heimgekehrt. Er hat eine griechische Braut gefunden und mitgebracht. Sie kennt unsere Gebräuche und Sprache nicht und das Wetter hier scheint ihr nicht gut zu tun, doch sie ist willig, das Beste aus ihrem neuen Heim zu machen.
column6: [From.GetTitledFirstName] ha llegado a casa de Miklagård y de su servicio con la Guardia varangian_traita, pero no está solo. Ha encontrado una esposa griega y la trajo con él. Ella no conoce nuestras costumbres ni el idioma, y el clima no le gusta demasiado, pero parece estar dispuesta a hacer lo mejor de su nuevo hogar.

column2: After many years in foreign lands, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has finally been released from his service to the mercenary company and returned home. Your son is a changed man, however. [From.Religion.GetName] no longer hold any interest for him, and he instead speaks incessantly of a Lord of Light and the horrors that await those who refuse to convert...
column3: Après plusieurs années dans les Cités Libres, [From.GetTitledFirstName] a enfin été dégagé de ses fonctions dans sa compagnie d'épées-louées et est rentré au bercail. Votre fils est cependant un homme changé. [From.Religion.GetName] ne l'intéressent plus et il parle sans cesse du Maître de la Lumière et des horreurs qui s'abattront sur ceux qui refusent de se convertir...
column4: Nach vielen Jahren in Griechenland, wurde [From.GetTitledFirstName] endlich aus seinem Dienst in der Warägergarde entlassen und ist heimgekehrt. Doch Euer Sohn ist ein gewandelter Mann. Die alten Götter interessieren ihn nicht länger, stattdessen spricht er ununterbrochen vom Christentum und den Schrecken, die jene erwarten, die nicht konvertieren...
column6: Tras muchos años en Grecia, [From.GetTitledFirstName] ha sido finalmente liberado de su servicio a la Guardia varangian_traita y ha regresado a casa. Sin embargo, tu hijo ha cambiado. Los viejos dioses ya no le interesan, y en cambio habla sin cesar de la Cristiandad y los horrores que le esperan a aquellos que se niegan a convertirse...

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned from foreign lands and his service to the mercenary company as a changed man. He is wiser, more confident in his own abilities and more knowledgeable in matters of war. It seems the time spent abroad did him good.
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName]est de retour des Cités Libres et de sa compagnie d'épées-louées et c'est un homme changé. Il est plus sage, plus sûr de lui et connaît très bien l'art de la guerre. Le temps qu'il a passé là-bas semble lui avoir fait du bien.
column4: [From.GetTitledFirstName] ist als gewandelter Mann aus Miklagard und dem Dienst in der Warägergarde zurückgekehrt. Er ist weiser, zuversichtlicher und besitzt neue Kenntnisse in Kriegsangelegenheiten. Es scheint, als habe ihm die Zeit bei den Griechen gut getan.
column6: [From.GetTitledFirstName] ha vuelto de Miklagård y de la Guardia varangian_traita como un hombre cambiado. Es más sabio, más seguro de sus propias habilidades y más eficiente en asuntos de guerra. Parece que el tiempo pasado en Grecia le ha hecho bien.

column2: Several former mercenaries have recently returned home after serving in foreign lands, and they bring news most grave. Your son, [From.GetTitledFirstName], fell in battle while campaigning. They assure you that he faced his enemy with bravery and slew many before their numbers overwhelmed him.
column3: Plusieurs anciennes épées-louées sont de retour de leur service dans els Cités Libres depuis peu et ils apportent de mauvaises nouvelles. Votre fils, [From.GetTitledFirstName], est tombé au combat lors d'une campagne dans les Terres Disputées. Ils vous assurent qu'il a affronté l'ennemi avec bravoure et qu'il en a tué plusieurs avant qu'ils aient eu raison de lui.
column4: Einige frühere Waräger Gardisten sind von ihrem Dienst beim Griechenkönig heimgekehrt und bringen schlechteste Neuigkeiten mit. Euer Sohn [From.GetTitledFirstName] ist in einer Schlacht in Serkland gefallen. Sie versichern Euch, dass er seinem Feind mit Tapferkeit begegnet ist und viele erschlug, bevor ihre schiere Zahl ihn überwältigte.
column6: Varios ex guardias varangian_traitos han regresado recientemente a casa después de servir al rey Griego, y traen noticias graves. Tu hijo, [From.GetTitledFirstName], cayó en la batalla mientras estaba de campaña en Serkland. Te aseguran que se enfrentó a su enemigo con valentía y que mató a muchos antes de que sus números lo abrumaron.

column2: [From.GetTitledFirstName] has at last returned from foreign lands on a ship filled with the spoils of war! Apparently the rulers from foreign lands are generous to those who serve them well, and there is gold here from all places from Hispania to India. Your son insists on sharing these riches with you, his loving father, for the benefit of House [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName].
column3: [From.GetTitledFirstName] est enfin de retour deCités Libres, à bord d'un navire contenant un impressionnant butin de guerre ! Les Grands Magistrats des Cités Libres sont apparemment très généreux avec ceux qui les servent bien, et il y a de l'or partout, de Braavos à Volantis. Votre fils insiste pour partager ses richesses avec vous, son père bien-aimé, pour le bien de la maison [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName].
column4: [From.GetTitledFirstName] ist endlich aus Griechenland heimgekehrt, auf einem großen Beiboot, gefüllt mit Kriegsbeute. Offenbar ist der Griechenkönig großzügig gegenüber jenen, die ihm gut dienen. Hier findet sich Gold aus allen Ecken Griechenlands, Serklands und darüber hinaus. Euer Sohn besteht darauf, den Reichtum mit Euch, seinem Vater, zu teilen.
column6: [From.GetTitledFirstName] por fin ha regresado de Grecia en un drakkar lleno de botines de guerra! Al parecer, el gran rey de los Griegos es generoso con los que le sirven bien, y hay oro aquí de todas partes del reino griego, Serkland y más allá. Tu hijo insiste en compartir estas riquezas contigo, su querido padre.

column2: Upon learning of the death of your father, you left the mercenary company and foreign lands for home on a ship filled with loot from your campaigns. It was a long and perilous journey back, but your feet are now firmly planted on the soil of the land that is your birthright. The throne is yours.
column3: Après avoir appris la mort de votre père, vous avez abandonné la compagnie d'épées-louées et quittez les Cités Libres sur un navire pour rentrer au bercail, rapportant un important butin amassé lors de vos campagnes. Le voyage du retour fut long et périlleux, mais vos pieds foulent maintenant la terre ferme, cette terre dont vous êtes l'héritier. Le trône est à vous.
column4: Als Ihr vom Tod Eures Vaters erfahrt, verlasst Ihr die Warägergarde und Miklagard in einem großen Beiboot, gefüllt mit der Beute Eurer Schlachten in Serkland. Es war eine lange und gefahrvolle Reise, doch jetzt setzt Ihr Eure Füße auf heimatliche Erde, dir Euer Geburtsrecht ist. Der Thron gehört Euch.
column6: Al enterarte de la muerte de tu padre, dejas la Guardia varangian_traita y dejas Miklagard para volver a casa en un drakkar lleno de botines de tus campañas en Serkland. Fue un largo y peligroso viaje de regreso, pero tus pies están ahora firmemente plantados en la tierra que es tu patrimonio. El trono es tuyo.

column2: Yes, there's a suitable candidate at court.
This heavily fortified collection of shipyards and armories is nothing less than an industrial complex centered around the docks of the Republic's capital.
column3: Ce regroupement très fortifié de chantiers navals et d’armureries n’est rien d’autre qu’un complexe industriel centralisé autour des quais de la capitale de la République.
column4: Diese schwer befestigte Ansammlung von Werften und Waffenkammern ist nicht weniger als ein industrieller Komplex rund um den Hafen der republikanischen Hauptstadt.
column6: Este conjunto fortificado de astilleros y armerías es todo un complejo industrial situado en torno a los muelles de la capital de la República.

column2: [From.Spouse.GetBestName] has discovered your affair with [From.Spouse.GetHerHis] spouse, [From.GetBestName] and is very angry with you.
Selling a prisoner into slavery will cause you to be viewed as a tyrant.
Expelled East African pagan holy order

Our revered ancestors fought to forge a world shaped in their image and shed their blood on the altar of their sacred cause. Their ancient exploits are nothing but legend now, and a great darkness has descended upon the realms of Man. Where are the titans of old now? Where is Alexandros, where is Seleukos, where is Kurus, where is Caesar? Can you remember their deeds and make their spectres bow their heads before you, in approval of your mighty leadership? Can you unite the bickering, warring realms of Man and forge an Empire as the world has never seen? Can you be the Restorer of the Realm of Light and banish the Darkness? Lux Invicta!

Philippos is the actual head of the Argeads, main descendants of Alexander the Great. Ruler of the Island Kingdom of Cyprus, Philippos is a boisterous, loud and burly person. A strong man, built for combat, yet he lacks any real talent for war. Married to the charming (insertdiadochiprincess), who has given him a sole male heir, Craterus. Philippos has no other ambitions than his banquets and military competitions, yet the blood of the Conqueror boils in the veins of his son, who tires of his father's self-indulging ways...

A man whom his troops call "Megas Alexandros reborn", Dorotheos is a famous Rhomaion general who has recently risen against the Empire, throwing the weakened state into a great crisis. His line, the Argeadai, are descendants of Alexander the Great through his illegitimate son Cassander. A proud, charismatic and passionate man, though some would see him as preposterous and overbearing, Dorotheos is prone to give great speeches about the glory of conquest, the bonds of men, and above all, the importance of leaders as active examples to their people, not distant rulers, secluded in their own high ideals. The dream of Dorotheos is the dream of his famed ancestor, to conquer all the worlds at the head of his army, and reach the shores of the Outer Ocean...
Apollonios, He of sedge and bee, son of Ra, is the ruler of Kyrene, last bastion of the true Ptolemaic dynasty in Aigyptos.
Once, the sons of Seleukos sat at Babylonia, the epicentre of civilization, and commanded the greatest empire since Alexander's.

The 17th descendant of Valentinian to be elected Princeps by the Senate, first among the citizens of Rome, Traianus is a shrewd and ruthless man, ready to do anything to further his ambitions. Though nowadays the authority of Rome extends no further than the city's own walls, Traianus has plans to change this. The greatest obstacles in his path are the rebels in Venetia and Neapolis, which cling to abominable heresies of Christianity and obsolete pagan traditions, and the various petty realms of the Lombard barbarians. Thanks to the recent Norman invasion, the perfect opportunity is presented to Traianus to make his move and restore Rome to it's rightful position...

Emperor of the Romans and Sol Invictus made flesh, Flavius descends from the famed Sun Emperor Julian, Saviour of the Light, much to his chagrin. Raised to be another Julian, in reality he is man beleaguered by his position, completely unsuited for the Imperial Throne. This, coupled with the Empire's instability in recent years, has led to a great crisis, as the vassal kings break away and a charismatic general from Thessalonica, claiming descent from Alexander the Great, threatens to usurp the throne and end Julian's line...

Some men trace their descent to a single famous figure, but Alexander Augustan, "August Leader" of Neapolis, descends from some of the greatest men to walk this world, with the blood of Julius Jupiter, Divus Augustus and Megas Alexandros in his veins, he is truly the son of the Divine, a fact he constantly reminds to everyone, for Alexander's ambition is only surpassed by his pomposity. In recent times, he has unilaterally declared the Senate in Rome null and void, claiming that only a man descending from the Divine Emperors and Conquerors of old can restore Rome to it's proper glory, and not a slave to the Jewish god.

Former Governor of Chaldia, and now the self-styled Despot of Trebizond, Kaisaros Konstantinian comes from the main line of Emperor Contantine's the Great descendants. Known for his irascible temperament, it his said that Kaisaros has declared independence out of anger for the state of the Empire and the general incompetence of it's officials, up to Emperor Flavius, nothing more than a pampered coward in his eyes. While he originally intended to seize the Imperial Throne, now, with the charismatic Dorotheos Argeadai in scene, Kaisaros instead plans to expand his realm north, and perhaps finally bring order to the coasts of the Black Sea...

At first sight, Lucius Aurelius is a genius the likes the world has not seen in centuries. Learned in the Classics and an accomplished statesman, he's everything a proper "philosopher king" should be. Except that deep down, Lucius is a man broken by the weight of expectation that his bloodline brings, that of the great Marcus Aurelius. A cynical man, to whom the church of Christus Sol is but another tool of the state, he is as well envious of those who have tranquiler lives. From the island-fortress of Venetia, Lucius prepares to lay claim to the whole of Rome, hoping that perhaps, succeeding in this endeavour will finally calm his inner demons...

Tiberius Severan is a man of duty before anything else. Duty to his realm, to his blood, and to Mithras, and nothing more. There's little personality beyond these facts, behind the grim and stonelike face of Tiberius. An accomplished warrior, uncharismatic, and completely disinterested for the frivolities of life, in order to maintain loyalty among his vassals, he relies on his best general, and only friend, Flavius Rodericus Vivaricus, an exile from the Gothic realms of Hispania, forever in debt to his liege for the shelter he provided from the deadly politics of the Visigoth courts. Tiberius will perhaps do anything to fulfil the duty of his bloodline, to restore Hispania for the Severans...

Second son of Gelimer III, youngest of age, Huneric started showing symptoms of the leper. Since the line was already safe with his elder brother, young Huneric spend his childhood sheltered in his quarters, with the tales of his mighty ancestor, King Gelimer, and other poetry epics as his only company. At age 11 he started studying military tactics under his uncle Sigeric and alongside his cousin Gelimer. When his father died of old age, Huneric plotted in order to seize Carthage from his unassuming elder brother Gaiseric. He ordered the assassination of Gaieric, and eventually executed his younger sister for her refusal to marry a political ally. Now, the Leper King is determined to fulfil the ambition of his ancestor, an Empire of all the Vandals, while his vengeful uncle, bitter over Huneric's betrayal of his family, has raised his son Gelimer in hopes to overthrow the Leper King before he leads Carthage to it's doom and to have him become the king that Huneric should have been.
